recipes.name: Mutton Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onions and cook until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, and cook for another minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until they break down.
Stir in coriander, cumin, turmeric, garam masala, and chili powder.
Add mutton pieces and cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in yogurt and cook for a few minutes.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until mutton is tender.
Season with salt and garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Stew
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened.
Add garlic, carrots, and celery, and cook for a few minutes.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
Stir in thyme and bay leaf.
Add chicken broth and water, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add potatoes and continue to simmer until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Potato Salad
instructions: Cook potatoes in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender, about 10 minutes.
Drain and let cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, Dijon mustard, and apple cider vinegar.
Add cooled potatoes, dill, and green onions.
Mix gently to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least an hour before serving.
Garnish with paprika before serving.

recipes.name: Lasagne
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Cook lasagne noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, cook ground beef with onion and garlic until browned.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, and sugar.
Simmer for 15 minutes, then season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese with Parmesan cheese.
Spread a thin layer of meat sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
Layer noodles over the sauce, then spread with some of the ricotta mixture and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Repeat layers, ending with a layer of meat sauce and mozzarella cheese on top.
Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and golden.
Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Prawns
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add prawns, paprika, and chili flakes.
Cook prawns for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until pink and opaque.
Stir in lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
